page.title: 06HONING BLACKSMITH SHOP
page.content: Mr. Alden is an engineer employed by a large road trailer manufacturing concern in the local market town of North Walsham. In his spare time he works in the old blacksmith's shop in the village. He would like this to become his full time occupation. Currently he makes ornamental garden pieces in the main. He demonstrated how to make a piece of metal into a spiral shape. He heated the metal in the forge and used pliers to bend and twist the hot metal. Later he beat a blunt metal bar into a point on his anvil. The forge once serviced the local estate and busily repaired agricultural machinery, and shod horses. The original hand bellows still survive in the shop, but Mr. Alden uses an electrically driven motor to create draught for the forge. He gave us an easter egg each.
